body_html:
It works for me in IPython.__version__ == '5.1.0' (python 3.4.3).

Maybe try saving the image instead of displaying it by replacing:

  f = BytesIO()
  PIL.Image.fromarray(a).save(f, fmt)
  display(Image(data=f.getvalue()))

With:

  PIL.Image.fromarray(a).save("/tmp/mandelbrot.jpg")
body_text:
It works for me in IPython.__version__ ==  '5.1.0' (python 3.4.3).
Maybe try saving the image instead of displaying it by replacing:
  f = BytesIO()
  PIL.Image.fromarray(a).save(f, fmt)
  display(Image(data=f.getvalue()))

With:
  PIL.Image.fromarray(a).save("/tmp/mandelbrot.jpg")
body:
It works for me in IPython.\_\_version\_\_ ==  '5.1.0' (python 3.4.3).

Maybe try saving the image instead of displaying it by replacing:
```
  f = BytesIO()
  PIL.Image.fromarray(a).save(f, fmt)
  display(Image(data=f.getvalue()))
```
With:
```
  PIL.Image.fromarray(a).save("/tmp/mandelbrot.jpg")
```
